column4: U.S. opens investigation in Tesla after fatal crash in Autopilot mode
column5: WASHINGTON A fatal accident in which the driver of a Tesla Motors Inc  Model S car operating in Autopilot mode was killed in a collision with a truck has prompted an investigation by federal highway safety regulators  the U.S. government and Tesla disclosed on Thursday. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Tesla crash raises concerns about autonomous vehicle regulation
column5: July 1 The fatal crash of a Tesla Motors Inc  Model S in Autopilot mode has turned up pressure on auto industry executives and regulators to ensure that automated driving technology is deployed safely.

column4: Tesla crash raises concerns about autonomous vehicle regulation
column5: The fatal crash of a Tesla Motors Inc  Model S in Autopilot mode has turned up pressure on auto industry executives and regulators to ensure that automated driving technology is deployed safely.

column4: DVD player found in Tesla Model S in May 7 crash -Fla officials
column5: DETROIT  July 1 The Florida Highway Patrol said on Friday that it found an aftermarket digital video disc (DVD) player in the wreckage of a Tesla Motors Inc Model S involved in a fatal May 7 crash.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. opens investigation in Tesla after fatal crash in Autopilot mode
column5: WASHINGTON  June 30 A fatal accident in which the driver of a Tesla Motors Inc Model S car operating in Autopilot mode was killed in a collision with a truck has prompted an investigation by federal highway safety regulators  the U.S. government and Tesla disclosed on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 2-BMW to develop driverless car technology with Intel  Mobileye
column5: * Autonomous vehicle platform open to others   (Adds comments from Mobileye chairman and Intel CEO)

column4: BRIEF-Mobileye NV  BMW Group  Intel team up to bring fully autonomous driving by 2021
column5: * BMW Group  Intel and Mobileye team up to bring fully autonomous driving to streets by 2021  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:    (Bengaluru Newsroom: +1 646 223 8780)

column4: BMW to develop driverless car technology with Intel  Mobileye
column5: FRANKFURT  July 1 BMW is teaming up with Intel and Mobileye to develop new technology for the auto industry that could put self-driving cars on the road by around 2021.
